text: Saint Maximus the Confessor (also known as Maximus the Theologian and Maximus of Constantinople) (born 580 â€“ 13 August, 662) was a Christian monk, theologian, and scholar. In his early life, he was a civil servant. He was also an aide to the Byzantine Emperor Heraclius. However, he gave up this life to become a monk. ==Further reading== *Maximus Confessor: Selected Writings (Classics of Western Spirituality). Ed. George C. Berthold.
